byline.contributor: Diaa Hadid reported from Ramallah, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations. Marlise Simons contributed reporting from Paris, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.
byline.original: By DIAA HADID and SOMINI SENGUPTA

abstract: Palestinians plan to submit evidence of Israeli war crimes occurring during July 2014 Gaza war between Israel and Hamas to International Criminal Court; analysts say while move shows Palestinians' commitment to standing up to Israel in international court, action may be symbolic since court has has no capacity to enforce judgments and is unable to secure arrest of those they are able to convict of war crimes.
lead_paragraph: Palestinian officials are planning to submit to the International Criminal Court in The Hague what they called evidence of Israeli crimes.

headline.main: Palestinians to Seek War Crimes Charges Against Israel at Hague Court
headline.print_headline: Palestinians to Seek War Crimes Charges Against Israel at Hague Court

snippet: Palestinian officials are planning to submit to the International Criminal Court in The Hague what they called evidence of Israeli crimes.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
